page.title: 15CLUBS - POTT SHRIGLEY
page.content: The Social Club is in the cellars under the village school. The premises are licensed to sell alcoholic drinks to members and their guests who can enjoy a chat or play cards, darts or dominoes. The Village Hall runs the club and owns the entire building, the hall being let privately upto twelve times a year for wedding receptions and parties and three rooms let to the school permanently. Local meetings and fund raising efforts are held in the hall. The Adventurers Youth Club meets weekly in the hall and is mainly for children under twelve years old. The Churchwomens Guild uses the hall as does the school's Parent Teacher Association. The Cricket Club is popular as is the Patchwork Club which meets at the home of a member to make beautiful bedspreads and cushioncovers and the Conservative Club is thriving.
